abstract.text: Appends an arc to the path.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Specifies the center point of the circle (in the current coordinate system) used to define the arc.
Specifies the radius of the circle used to define the arc.
Specifies the starting angle of the arc (measured in radians).
Specifies the end angle of the arc (measured in radians).
The direction in which to draw the arc.

This method adds the specified arc beginning at the current point. The created arc lies on the perimeter of the specified circle. When drawn in the default coordinate system, the start and end angles are based on the unit circle shown in the image in
. For example, specifying a start angle of
draws the bottom half of the circle. However, specifying the same start and end angles but setting the
draws the top half of the circle.
After calling this method, the current point is set to the point on the arc at the end angle of the circle.

abstract.text: A false value.
A true value.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A path that consists of straight and curved line segments that you can render in your custom views.
Appends an arc to the path.
Appends a cubic Bézier curve to the path.
Appends a straight line to the path.
Appends a quadratic Bézier curve to the path.
Appends the contents of the specified path object to the path.
The Core Graphics representation of the path.
Closes the most recent subpath.
The current point in the graphics path.
Creates and returns a new Bézier path object with an arc of a circle.
Moves the path’s current point to the specified location.
Removes all points from the path, effectively deleting all subpaths.
A structure that contains a point in a two-dimensional coordinate system.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
The basic type for all floating-point values.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
